At the front of this bacchanal, in the seat of honor at the front of the hall, BRUCE sits, massive joints of beef and turkey in each hand, eating like King Henry the eighth.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (spitting food) More meat!! As a SEXY WAITRESS hauls over another massive joint of beef, Bruce grabs her and plops her into his lap. While the Waitress GIGGLES at the attention, KELLY watches all this with a disgusted glare. Suddenly, there’s an announcement from a frontier-outfitted SQUARE DANCE CALLER.

dialogues.speaker: SQUARE DANCE CALLER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen. Grab your partners! Enthusiastic townfolk “grab their partners” (male + female) and sashay out toward the center of the floor. With a smile, Bruce tosses his leg o’ whatever, pushes past the Waitress and makes a bee-line toward Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Ma’am, may I have this dance? The Mayor shoots Kelly a look and she reluctantly comes out around the bar, taking Bruce’s arm. Even though she clearly doesn’t like being here, there’s something in Bruce’s infectious, giddy enthusiasm that starts to get to her. As they get in formation with the others, Bruce whispers to her...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You realize I have no idea what I’m doing.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I’m sure that’s a first.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Not really. I haven’t known what I’ve been doing for years. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 55.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bruce keeps watching her, catching the hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What was that?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No no, both sides of your mouth curled at the edges. There’s an old Indian word for this phenomena... Kawatatcheeacha... Cherokee for “she who smiles at one she is beginning to not hate.” Kelly rolls her eyes, but not so mean this time. With a hint of actual pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Shut up and dance. A Square-Dance band takes position on the floor and the room fills with music. The Square Dance Caller barks out orders to the dancers.

dialogues.speaker: SQUARE DANCE CALLER
dialogues.text: Bow to your partner! As the dancers begins to move, Kelly tries to help Bruce navigate through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Just follow my lead...

dialogues.speaker: SQUARE DANCE CALLER
dialogues.text: Now swing your partner and dosi- doe, pass the axle then let go! While Kelly tries to actually keep up with the dance moves, Bruce is a loose-limbed marvel, his legs swinging around like some kind of string-puppet. SQUARE DANCE CALLER (CONT’D) Allemande left with a right hand star, box the gnat and allemande thar! Bruce’s a terrible dancer, but the Townfolk are being polite because of his mission, and his enthusiasm continues to be somewhat infectious. So infectious that he finally pulls away from Kelly, twirls toward the official Square Dance Caller and grabs his microphone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 56.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (calling dance) Now swing your partner toward the door, then empty your pockets and pretend you're poor... The Townfolk are swirling around the dance floor, but these are “unusual” calls to say the least. But, in an effort to keep Bruce happy, they all swing their partners toward the door, then pull out their pockets, sending wallets, keys and change spilling to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling dance) Allemande left then allemande right, then spoon in together all “Brokeback” like... The Dancers look at one another then comply, doing the dance move, then the women jam their butts into the male dancer’s crotch... Taking advantage of a musical “bridge”, Bruce breaks into a crazy, tangled-legged dance that ends with him doing the splits in the middle of the dance floor. still holding the microphone, Bruce picks himself up and advances on an astonished Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (calling dance) Now as this dance is coming to a close, see if she’ll kiss you without holding her nose... With a swoop, Bruce grabs Kelly and pulls her into a full fledged, bent-over backward smooch. She flails a little at first, then the flailing stops and for a moment, she seems to be anticipating the kiss. Then:

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You wanna move that hand? Reveal Bruce’s hand completely inside and up the back of Kelly’s shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Oops. Meanwhile, all around Bruce and Kelly, the dancers are locked in similar steamy embraces, but with Bruce distracted and not making any more square dance call, they’re groaning as they try to hold their awkward positions, turning blue as they remain mouth-to-mouth...  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Kelly step outside the noisy bar and start down the street. At night the town is actually quite lovely, a throwback to an earlier, more innocent time...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Ahhh. I could use a little fresh air. Kelly is still a little wary of Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Me too. (eyes on him, wary) And just fresh air. They start down the sidewalk together, the lights from the businesses twinkling in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: town) Even with everything that’s happened, God I love this place.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I grew up in a town just like it. Little place in Michigan. You ever hear of it?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Michigan?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: “Little Place.” About fifteen miles North of Dearborn.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: People really cared about one another out there. “Values” meant more than half-price cereal at the supermarket. (remembering) Made my first movie there, when I was still in High School.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Really? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 58.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: We were kids... naive, innocent. We wanted to make a film that reflected our hopes and dreams...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What was it called?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: “Blade of the Skullripper.” Guess that’s when I got the acting bug.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You’ve come a long way since then.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (sardonic) Guess you haven’t seen any of my recent movies. Kelly smiles at that.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, Jeff’s shown me a couple. I don’t know about the plots, but you’re usually pretty good in them. Bruce is taken by the compliment.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You really mean that?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t say it if I didn’t. Bruce stops and turns to face Kelly. A romantic moment in the offing.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You’re just full of surprises, Kelly Graham. You’re going to find this hard to believe, but I’ve always been shy. Maybe that’s why I come on so strong...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hey, I came on a little strong myself.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (moving in for kiss) It’s never been... easy for me to... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 59.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: ...express my... true feelings... As Bruce is about to kiss her, Kelly suddenly looks over her shoulder, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You want to move that hand? PULL OUT to reveal Bruce’s hand clamped securely on Kelly’s butt cheek. He jerks it away.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I’ll let it go... this time... Kelly’s already forgiven him. They’re closing for their first KISS when there’s a HARUMMPH off camera. Bruce and Kelly both look over in surprise, seeing EVERYONE FROM THE DANCE in the street, staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Campbell. (taps watch) It’s time. Bruce looks at Kelly. Back at the Mayor. Desperate to consummate the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Campbell...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: For the love of God, I can smell her Chap-Stick! But the Mayor’s expression says “nope!” OFF this moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors whip open and Bruce moves inside, checking out the walls of rifles, shotguns, pistols and other weapons. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 60.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zoom in on Bruce’s face, hard and serious. The bald STOREKEEPER waits expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: All right, small-town America. Show me what you’ve got. In a montage of image we see a tough man’s hands getting ready for some monster killin’ action. Capable hands strap on a flak-jacket with multiple pockets for weapons. Cinch up a sheath for a big-ass hunting knife. Fingers quickly punch shells into a shotgun. A hand SPINS a revolver old west style, dropping it into a leather holster. Hands strap on double shotgun holsters, plunging double- barrels into each holster. Finally the hands grab a Jason-esque HOCKEY MASK. As the hands prepare to put on the mask... PULL BACK to reveal the incredibly well-armed/armored man is actually... THE MAYOR.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m set. Continue to PULL BACK to reveal Bruce standing nearby, totally unarmed, watching incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Anything left for me? Jeff reaches behind the counter and swings up a silver plated CHAINSAW, banging it down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I had it made special, just for you. A Briggs and Stratton two- barrel with a half-inch claw. Bruce picks up the saw, hefting it, checking it out. It’s been customized with a Bruce Campbell signature on the gleaming blade.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sweet. (tosses it aside) And if I were going up against a tree, possibly even appropriate. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bruce starts pointing at guns, grenades, bear-traps and other devices hanging on display in the gun store, like a guy pointing at the food pictures in a Chinese restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gimme one of those, two of those, a handful of those... attaboy, just keep ‘em coming, Cueball... The bald STOREKEEPER loads the weaponry up in Bruce’s arms, weighing him down with rifles, shotguns and bazookas. Bruce staggers a moment under the weight, then suddenly just DUMPS everything.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who wants a piece of this? Jeff and several other Townfolk steps forward. Casual, Bruce starts tossing them weapons. He hurls a rifle ata squinch-faced MAN smoking a PIPE...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you go, Popeye... He tosses a ‘45 Magnum pistol at a skinny looking SCHOOLTEACHER TYPE...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Schwarzenegger gets the “make my day”... On a roll, Bruce tosses three or four hand grenades to a second MAN, nonchalantly going for style points and tossing the last one under his leg.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heads up! Hup hup hup! As the Grenade Man struggles/juggles to catch them, the Storekeeper is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: Mr. Campbell, those are live grenades. Bruce gives the Storekeeper a knowing wink.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Pull the other one, spit-shine! (rising) The rest of you, don’t be shy! Load up! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As the other Townfolk gather around the pick up their weapons, including a severe looking “FARM WOMAN” who samples several pieces, then picks up one of the bear traps.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure you know how to handle that, sister? The Farm Woman pulls a carrot out of her pocket, puts it between the trap’s jaws and triggers the mechanism. Chopping the carrot off at the root.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right! You’re taking point! As the Farmers continue to arm up, Jeff comes up beside Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Are you ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kid, I made a movie in Bulgaria. I’m ready for anything. The Mayor and several other male TOWNFOLK nod knowingly at the seemingly non-sequitur comment as Bruce moves to the doorway of the store. He frames himself heroically in the doorway, looking back at his peeps.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of cars and pick-ups tear through downtown Sawville, past the bar, where KELLY watches with worry. Some of the armed-up Townfolk are standing in the back of the pick-ups, waving and firing their guns in rowdy celebration of the battle to come. Suddenly, BRUCE’S TRUCK skids to a stop outside the bar, dust billowing up around it (even though it’s a paved street... what up with that?) Bruce emerges from the wafting dust, practically in Kelly’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Hey baby. How about a kiss for good luck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 63.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Apparently moved by the gesture, Kelly looks Bruce in the eye. For an instant it looks like they’re going to finally kiss, then:

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You wanna move that hand? PAN DOWN to reveal Bruce’s hand clamped on Kelly's boob.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Just checking. The “romantic” moment shattered, Bruce backs toward his truck, jaunty as ever.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put yourself on simmer, sweetheart. ‘Cause when I come back, I plan to stake a claim to the prettiest green eyes I’ve ever seen. (to the others) Now let’s do this thing! As the pick-ups and cars tear out, HOLD ON Kelly, who looks worried and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: My eyes are brown... As the cars careen into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A field outside some woods somewhere on the outskirts of town. The full moon offers some illumination along with the fiery TORCHES being carried by several Townfolk. They’re also all equipped with small personal WALKIE TALKIES. As the move through the area, the MAYOR spots something on the ground. NOTE that the Mayor is still wearing his Friday The 13th hockey mask and all the weaponry/accoutrements that he gathered at the gun store.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Hold it. What do you make of this? Bruce kneels, authoritative, picks up a handful of gravel, sifting it through his fingers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 64.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (thoughtful) Looks like gravel.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: I mean these tracks. A set of well defined, devil-hoof footprints are visible IN the gravel.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’d say we’ve found us a Guan-Di. Bruce rises as the townspeople gather ‘round.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: No surprise. The killings have all been in this general area. (rising, somber) We're on it’s hunting ground now.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (with gravitas) It’s not hunting us, Mayor. We're hunting him. The Townfolk exchange dubious looks.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: No, I think it’s still hunting us. Bruce can sense the “nervousness” of his team.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s liable to get ugly out there. So when things look bad, when it looks like you’re not going to make it, remember two things. One, even if you don’t have medical insurance, emergency rooms are mandated by Federal law to treat severely injured patients. That doesn’t exactly inspire confidence.

dialogues.speaker: GUY WITH TORCH
dialogues.text: What’s number two?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (pauses for effect) None of that matters, ‘cause Bruce Campbell’s got your back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With that rousing thought galvanizing them, the Townfolk ROAR their approval and the whole posse takes off into the woods. Bruce and the Woman lugging the bear-trap take the lead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Townfolk and Bruce have fanned out in the dark woods. Flickering torches and flashlights through the trees. Random walkie-talkie messages SQUAWK through the silence.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: This is Henderson. I’m crossing Haselton Road... no sign of the demon, over. Jeff hangs close to Bruce as they stalk through the underbrush, their guns out and ready.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: It’s quiet. Almost too...

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: (super-loud) Wait! Bruce JUMPS at the super-loud warning.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: I think I heard something... Suddenly, the weird, ominous sound of the Guan-Di echoes through the area. Sort of like a cross between some Chinese chant and the screech of an owl. Bruce is impressed, glances toward Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: When this is over, you gotta introduce me to the guy who does your foley!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WOODS
dialogues.text: A dark figure, the Guan-Di, floats through the darkness. Moonlight glints off the demon’s sword and ritual costume, but it’s barely visible.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: Wait... wait... Oh God, I think I see it, over!! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bruce grabs his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Good! Now see if you can flank him and ease him around to my position, over.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: He’s got a sword, over!!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Right. Just move him on over and...

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: It’s a big sucker! Bruce is getting annoyed with all the pointless “delays.”

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Point taken! Now please lead El Demonostro my way so I can... (makes “air quotes” for a baffled Jeff) .--”open fire” and we can all get back to town...

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: Shit, he saw me! He’s turning this way...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE VOICE
dialogues.text: God oh shit oh AHHHHHHHH -- The Walkie Voice suddenly does DEAD. Bruce stares at the Walkie in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Hello? He hits the “talk” button, getting loud SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Testing, testing. Dammit, are you bringing me this “demon” or not? Nothing but static on the walkie-talkie. Really annoyed now, Bruce stands up, waving his arms impatiently. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 67.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody. Cut, cut! (annoyed) I’m trying to stay in character, but radio-schmucko seems to lost a couple pages of the script... Suddenly something CAREENS out of the darkness, landing at Bruce’s feet with a THUD. It’s the bear-trap Woman’s SEVERED HEAD, steam-breath still puffing from her lips. Bruce looks down at the head, still not quite understanding what’s really going on. Thinks it’s a make- up effect.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Breath’s a nice touch. Dead ahead, several more TOWNFOLK suddenly rush out of the woods, straight toward Bruce, SCREAMING in terror.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the -- ? Where are you going? As one of the slower Townfolk tries to get away, the fiercesome figure of the Guan-Di suddenly looms over him, his sword LASHING OUT and splitting the man’s head in two!

dialogues.speaker: GAHHGHH
dialogues.text: Jeff grabs at Bruce’s sleeve, tugging at him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Bruce! Do something! As Bruce gapes in disbelief, the Guan-Di emerges from the shadows, rising to it’s full eight foot height. Sword dripping blood, it’s eyes blazing red. Suddenly (and improbably) there’s a flash of lightning, and Bruce gets his first full-on look at the terrifying demon.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING TOWNIE
dialogues.text: It’s the Guan-Di! ZOOM IN on Bruce’s astonished face as the full, awful reality hits him like a sledgehammer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 68.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You mean the son of a bitch is

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Shoot it! Shoot it! Bruce’s action hero derring-do suddenly vanishes. Terrified, panicking, Bruce struggles to whip up his shotgun. Shaking like Don Knotts, he blindly FIRES! BLAM! Hitting one of the fleeing Townspeople in the shoulder!

dialogues.speaker: FLEEING TOWNIE
dialogues.text: AGHHH! My arm! Freaking out, Bruce shoots wildly again. BLAM!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER FLEEING TOWNIE
dialogues.text: OWwWwWW, my leg!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Gangway!! Terrified, Bruce starts to run away from the approaching demon, firing blindly over his shoulder. BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: YET ANOTHER FLEEING TOWNIE
dialogues.text: AHHH, my ear!!

dialogues.speaker: TERRIFIED TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Stop shooting, stop shooting! As Bruce bolts, Jeff can’t believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Bruce! Where are you going? Bruce tosses his shotgun into the brush and starts to run full tilt.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: The hell away from here! The Guan-Di continues advance, raising his blood-soaked sword, a genuinely scary vision in the moonlit woods as BRUCE picks up speed, hurdling brush and fallen logs like an Olympian, eventually passing some of the scared Townies who had a head start on him. This includes the Mayor, still in his hockey mask. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 69.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR
dialogues.text: Campbell, you coward! You were supposed to protect us!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Branch. The Mayor doesn’t understand the comment until he SLAMS face first into a low hanging branch. As the Mayor flips over onto his ass, Bruce doesn’t even slow down, running back into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing hard, the SCREAMS of the Townspeople echoing behind him, Bruce frantically runs to the parked cars and pick-ups, trying to find one with the keys in the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No keys?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperate, Bruce throws open the door to a car and leans under the dashboard, ripping out the ignition wires. He breaks apart two of the wires and tries to spark the engine to start, but instead he electrocutes himself!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: All right, coil wire to the ignit... (as he gets a spark)

dialogues.speaker: GAHHYGG
dialogues.text: The force of the electric shock SLAMS Bruce’s head into the underside of the dash.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Owwww! Dazed, he falls forward on the exposed wires and gets ZAPPED AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: JEEZZ
dialogues.text: Struggling to get away from the sparking wires, Bruce suddenly hears a gentle DING-A-LING of a bicycle bell.  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 70. EXT. STAGING AREA —- NIGHT Bruce pulls out of the car as LITTLE KID on a tiny “Sting Ray” type bike (!) rides through the scene. Canvas newspaper delivery bags on the back of his bike.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE KID
dialogues.text: Paper, Mister? Bruce thinks a moment, then has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Yeah! As the Little Kid stops, reaching for a newspaper, Bruce runs for him, glancing around guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, kid! Your parents around?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Uhh --

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Good! Desperate, Bruce

dialogues.speaker: THROWS THE KID OFF THE BIKE
dialogues.text: then jumps on the banana seat, churning his legs as fast as he can. Teetering, barely keeping his balance, Bruce races away from the staging area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce races the small bike out onto the main road, legs still churning wildly, when he’s BLINDED by on-rushing headlights. Bruce throws an arm up to protect his eyes and LOSE CONTROL OF THE BIKE, sailing off the road and crashing into a tree. As he picks himself up from the brush, the car that almost hit him backs up to check on him. An OLD LADY driver rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Young man, are you all right? Bruce runs for the car like a drowning man clawing for a life preserver. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 71.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You gotta get me out of here! The Old Lady points to the cat carrier resting on the car’s passenger seat. The old tabby inside MEOWS affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but there’s no room... Frantic, Bruce suddenly grabs the Old Lady’s arm and THROWS HER out of the truck!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: There is now! As the Old Lady hits the pavement, Bruce jumps into the trunk and PUNCHES IT. As gravel spews from the tires, the Old Lady raises a feeble hand.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Wait! My kitty-kitty! As if in response, the cat carrier suddenly FLIES out the passenger window, accompanied by a loud MEOWWWWW! INT. OLD LADY’S CAR - NIGHT Desperate, sweaty, crazed, Bruce hunkers over the steering wheel and careens down the dark road, driving like a bat outta hell. The light from the dashboard gives his face an eerie, “up-shadow” cast.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Demons... monsters... what the hell were they thinking? Thing’s on my ass now... supernatural bastard... I gotta make tracks but fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Bruce’s POV as he hauls ass, headlights stabbing the darkness, suddenly flashing across a WOMAN pushing a BABY CARRIAGE! And Bruce is heading straight for her!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Oh hell! Bruce CRANKS the wheel to avoid the woman...  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swerving, careening headlights of Bruce’s stolen car suddenly appear in the distance. In the foreground, a couple of disinterested Townsies, munching on snow-cones, take vague notice.

dialogues.speaker: DISINTERESTED TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Wonder who that is? In the distance, the headlights suddenly swerve OFF THE ROAD. There’s a distant SCREEECH of tires, the CRUNCH of metal, then a muffled “plumphh” as FLAMES erupt in the distance. Then A SINGLE FIGURE begins to run/limp down the street. As he gets closer, we see it’s Bruce, silhouetted by the flames, yelping every time he lands on his injured leg.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (limping) Son of a OWW gotta get OHH outta here SHIT... Bruce runs up to the two Disinterested Townies and grabs them by their jackets. Bruce is crazy/angry with fear.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need a car! Pronto!

dialogues.speaker: DISINTERESTED TOWNIE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you that demon-fighting fella? That pulls Bruce up short. As he looks around, more Sawville shopkeepers and residents emerge onto the sidewalk. Bruce begins to realize he’s making a “scene.”

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, that’s me. (thinks, then) I, uhh, I blew the thing to Kingdom Come! Yeah, that’s it... I just came back for, uhh, shovels. To scrape him up. And trash bags! It’s helluva mess out there... As Bruce “improvises”, a pick-up truck rolls down the street. Seeing that the open bed is empty, Bruce throws a “goodbye” salute toward the baffled Townies and (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LEAPS INTO THE BACK. Grinning at his good luck...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So long, suckers! .»+.as the truck pulls over and parks, the driver getting out and going to one of the shops.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Son of a -- Beside himself, Bruce leaps out of the truck as the sounds of CAR HORNS rise in the distance. It’s the CARAVAN of surviving monster fighters, coming back into town. Hearing all the racket, KELLY comes out of her bar, worried. When she sees Bruce, they lock eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce. Where's Jeff?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Jeff?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You just left him out there?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No! I mean, kind of! (off her disdain) Come on, lady, nobody told me this monster was real! Down the street, a GRAYHOUND BUS comes around a corner, getting ready to pull out of town.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (desperate, to Kelly) Shoe’s untied! Kelly looks down. Bruce takes the opportunity to SPRINT FOR THE BUS just as JEFF steps out of one of the approaching cars, devastated by Bruce’s betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Mom! Where's Bruce? More townfolk emerge from their cars, some still bleeding and seriously pissed off after Bruce’s shoot ‘em up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 74.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT IN ARM GUY
dialogues.text: Thespian bastard shot me in the arm! Bruce, running for the bus, turns and runs backwards as he tries to respond to the charges.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: SHOT IN LEG GUY
dialogues.text: He got me in the leg! As the crowd becomes a mob and begins to surge toward Bruce, he BOLTS for the Grayhound.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (to bus) Wait! Wait! For the luvva God, stop! He reaches the bus and slaps at the side until it grinds to a stop. Gasping, Bruce runs for the door and jumps inside, the bus pulling out just as the mob reaches it.

dialogues.speaker: TOWNSFOLK
dialogues.text: Get out of town! Go back to Hollywood! You shot my Uncle! Gasping, Bruce moves to the back of the bus and looks out the rear window as the mob recedes, throwing ROCKS, FAUCETS, a round POKER TABLE and other handy items against the glass. But Bruce’s focus is on KELLY AND JEFF, standing together. As they recede in the distance, their mutual looks of betrayal are like daggers in Bruce’s heart. As Bruce settles into his seat, utterly devastated, a elbow-jointed piece of plumbing pipe BANGING behind him... EXT. BRUCE’S HOUSE - DAYBREAK The bus stops at the driveway by Bruce’s trailer and he gets off, shoulders slumping, a shell of a man. As Bruce nears the stoop of his trailer, he spots a padded manila envelope on the porch. Dissolute, Bruce grabs it and heads inside.  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 75. INT. BRUCE’S HOUSE - DAY Bruce walks into his trailer and spots SamNRob on his blanket. After his awful day, Bruce is aching for a little affection.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Cute little Sam’nRob. At least I still have you. (kneeling) C’mere, boy. The dog just stares at Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, little guy. Here boy. Here boy. Come on, fella. Come to Daddy. That’s it. Come on. Here boy, here boy, here boy... (suddenly mad) Son of a bitch!! Bruce HURLS the manila envelope at the dog, getting a loud BARK and SCREECH. Giving up on the mutt, Bruce wanders to a cupboard, pulling out a box of generic “Fruit Loops” cereal. He fills a bowl with cereal, then grabs a quart of milk from the fridge and sloshes it on.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘ll feel better after breakfast... it’s most important meal of the day... He’s about to dig in when he notices the “message” light blinking on his answering machine. Heartbroken, he punches the “play” button.

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
dialogues.text: (jaunty voice) This is Bruce Campbell, actor extraordinaire. If you’re young, female and not currently incarcerated, page me at star-998, otherwise leave a message after the tone... BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: DEBORAH
dialogues.text: (on machine) Bruce, it’s Deborah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 76.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Deb...? (grabbing machine) Deborah?

dialogues.speaker: DEBORAH
dialogues.text: (on machine) There’s something I’ve been meaning to tell you, something that’s been weighing on me ever since our divorce. Bruce clutches the answering machine to his heart, praying for good news.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Of course I forgive you!

dialogues.speaker: DEBORAH
dialogues.text: (on machine) ...it’s the alimony payment. It’s just not cutting it.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Huh?!

dialogues.speaker: DEBORAH
dialogues.text: (on machine) My lawyer’s filed a motion to have it increased, along with a restraining order, so don’t even try returning this call... Fuming, Bruce RIPS the answering machine cord out of the wall, then smashes the box on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Heartless hell-spawn! Emotionally crushed, Bruce spots the manila envelope near Sam’Rob’s dog blanket. He rips it open and pulls out TWO SCRIPTS. “Cavealien 3 and 4.” As Bruce’s jaw falls open, he notices a little buck slip paper-clipped to the first script, “From The Desk Of Mills Toddner.” Hand written under that, “Pack your bags, baby, they’re back-to-back in Romania! Love ya, Mills.”

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No... NO... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His life falling to pieces before his eyes, Bruce stumbles back, tripping over a throw rug. As he flails, he accidentally smacks the bowl of Fruit Loops, SENDING THEM FLYING. As Bruce lands on his ass, the Fruit Loops and milk explode over him, the cereal sticking to him like bizarre sequins. As Bruce lies there, dazed, milk and cereal dripping off him, THE DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on... just a minute... Still dripping Fruit Loops, Bruce staggers to the door. He throws it open, revealing... A HARD-EDGED STRIPPER (KASEY) IN A FLAG BIKINI, waving two lit sparklers. Bottle of whiskey under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m busy!

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: And I'm Kasey, the famous singing prostitute! (singing) I’m here to offer birthday greetings and wish you lots of luck, and if you’re really really nice I’ll even toss in a f--

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (cuts her off) Who sent you?! Kasey fumbles in her tiny purse, finding a note...

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: “From your friend and agent, Mills Toddner. Here’s some birthday sugar, baby.” Bruce stares at Kasey in slack-jawed disbelief. Fruit Loops dangling from his hair and face.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: This was my surprise? A woman?

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: Actually I’m only half-way through my trans-gender surgeries, so technically... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kasey reaches for her bikini bottoms, like she’s going to pull them down and show Bruce something “surprising.” Bruce waves his hands frantically.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: For the love of God, stop!! As Kasey relents, Bruce’s phone RINGS. Struggling to maintain his emotional equilibrium, he staggers back to answer it as Kasey enters, looking around curiously.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Campbell residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff’s on the phone, talking to Bruce from his trailer.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Bruce. It’s Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing) You little BASTARD. You're the one who dragged me into this nightmare! Now I suppose you’re going to chew my ass for taking a powder.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No. I... I just wanted to thank you. Bruce looks at the phone like Jeff's speaking Swahili.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Thank me?!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: For teaching me the meaning of “courage.”

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I ran like a cheap mascara!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: That’s just it. I was trying to dodge my responsibilities by dumping them on you. You showed me that I have to face this thing on my own. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 79.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bruce can’t believe he’s being let off the hook. Improvs to suggest that was his plan all along.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Well... thought I’d help you shape up... I’m glad you’ve seen the error of your ways... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Truth is, I’m the one who unleashed the Guan-Di. So it’s up to me to kill it. The reality of Jeff's plan hits Bruce’s addled brain.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You’re gonna take on Toshiro McShithead?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: All I needed was a push. Thank you, Mr. Campbell... As the line goes dead...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kid! KID!! (slams down phone) Son of a --

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: Boyfriend troubles?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (reeling) No! Distraught, Bruce paces his living room. He grabs the bottle that Kacey brought and spins off the cap, about to drink himself to oblivion when he hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stupid kid... he’s gonna get himself killed! (about to drink) What do I care? I’ve got my own problems! As Bruce stares at the bottle, suddenly two tiny Bruce figures appear on his shoulders. One is the “Angel” Bruce, complete with simpering voice. The other is the “Devil” Bruce, with a growling nasty voice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 80.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL BRUCE
dialogues.text: I’m your good nature, Bruce. (simpering voice) If Jeff goes up against the Guan- Di alone, he’1l be cut to ribbons. You've got to help the lad!

dialogues.speaker: DEVIL BRUCE
dialogues.text: (gruff voice) Don’t listen to him! Kid’s an asshole! Fuck him! Nobody lives forever!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL BRUCE
dialogues.text: (simpering voice) How can you even think such a thing? This young man is our biggest fan! As this conversation continues, two more, even TINIER Bruce figures magically appear -- this time on the ANGEL BRUCE’S tiny shoulders! ANGEL BRUCE’S ANGEL (simpering voice) You’re absolutely right, Angel Bruce. Remind him that our fans support us no matter what. ANGEL BRUCE’S DEVIL (gruff voice) What the hell are you talking about? If Campbell takes the dirt nap, we’re all toast! Surprisingly, that last piece of logic hits home with Angel Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL BRUCE
dialogues.text: (simpering voice) Well, he does have a point. And young Jeff did release the fiend... (to big Bruce) Maybe we should let him die... Bruce suddenly SCREAMS, waving his arms, dissipating the multiple bickering devil/angel figures.

dialogues.speaker: AHHHH
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bruce looks at the whisky bottle, sorely tempted, then suddenly HURLS it across the room. Resolve building in his face.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Kasey) You. Uncle Sam-Antha. How’d you like to make a quick fifty bucks? Kasey rises with a matter of fact sigh, reaching for her bikini bottoms.

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: Story of my life...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: No! I need a ride!

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: That’s why I’m here...

dialogues.speaker: KASEY
dialogues.text: Oh. Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Little town called Sawville. (gritting his teeth) Looks like I’ve got to kill me a Guan-Di. As Kasey blankly mulls this non-sequitur...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kasey’s VW Bug putt-putts into town, pulling over on main street. Regardless of the weather, Kasey’s still in her sexy patriotic bikini. As they both get out...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sit. Try not to blow anybody until I get back. Bruce starts down the sidewalk, the same walk he took the day before. But this time the reaction is much different. He’s met with sneers and snarls. Gingerly, he approaches the (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GROCERY STORE, display of apples out front. Bruce starts to reach for an apple, like yesterday, only to have the Shopkeeper slam a BUTCHER KNIFE down inches from his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: SHOPKEEPER
dialogues.text: Apples aren’t for sale! Bruce backs off, counting his fingers, and continues down the sidewalk, pausing in front of the APPLIANCE STORE. A display of ghetto-blaster radios out front. Bruce offers a meek little wave to the Appliance Store Owner, who angrily punches the play button on one of the radios.

dialogues.speaker: APPLIANCE STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: Wrote this last night, bitch. A chugging RAP SONG starts to play...

dialogues.speaker: RADIO RAP SONG
dialogues.text: (sing-song rap) BRUCE CAMPBELL, man used to be it, now BRUCE CAMPBELL, man’s fulla shit. Actor-man said he’d save our town from fear, but all we saw was his yellow rear, BRUCE CAMPBELL, dat’s right, BRUCE CAMPBELL, runs from a fight, BRUCE CAMPBELL, got balls like a mouse, BRUCE CAMPBELL, he’s worthless louse... (etc) Bruce moves off from the blaring rap-song, passing AN ELDERLY MAN, the one who gave him the sign of the cross earlier.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to thank you for your blessing, kind sir... The Elderly Man suddenly HAWKS an enormous loogie into Bruce’s face, leaving strands of saliva dangling from Bruce’s chin. As Bruce tries to mop this off, he comes across the same group of SCHOOL CHILDREN he had bumped into the day before. Seeing Bruce, they rush up excitedly, but instead of “hail the conquering hero,” they start kicking and punching him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 83.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: You piece of shit! Coward! Wimp!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Come on, kids, I did my best -- The First Kid KICKS HIM.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST KID
dialogues.text: You shot my Dad!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND KID
dialogues.text: I drew this picture of you! The kid shows Bruce the drawing: Bruce running away from a monster, a yellow streak up his back, lumps of poop coming out of his pants. As the kids jeer, a THIRD KID, the one who had drawn Bruce getting his head cut off last time, tentatively shows Bruce his new drawing.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD KID
dialogues.text: I still believe in you, Mr. Campbell. The drawing shows Bruce standing on the neck of the dead monster, triumphant. Bruce is touched...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Gosh, thanks... But before Bruce can get too mushy, the other kids turn on Third Kid and start pounding him, ripping his drawing to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: THIRD KID
dialogues.text: OWW! STOP!! Wahhhhhh... Bruce uses the distraction to ease away, finally reaching Kelly’s bar. A CLOSED sign in the window. Frustrated, Bruce is trying to figure his next move when he notices a billow of smoke rising from behind the building. He goes around to the side, where KELLY is standing over a burn barrel, grabbing papers and posters from the back of her pick-up bed and jamming them into the flames. NOTE: There’s a stocked gun rack inside the pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kelly! Kelly turns, eyes narrowing when she sees Bruce. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 84.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Go back to Hollywood, big shot. Find yourself some hot and cold running starlets. You and I are so over...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kelly, please. I’m not a shallow sex machine like most Hollywood types... As Bruce struggles to reason with Kelly, KACEY, still in her bikini, marches up on them.

dialogues.speaker: KACEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Mister, you owe me $50! Kelly is stunned. Bruce is mortified.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Just a second...

dialogues.speaker: KACEY
dialogues.text: And we still need to have sex! As Bruce stammers, Kacey pats the ground, like that’s where they should do it.

dialogues.speaker: KACEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right here would work. (to Kelly) Hey, B-cup, got a blanket we could borrow?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: She's a...

dialogues.speaker: KACEY
dialogues.text: (catches him) Technically I’m still a “he”... Bruce’s shoulders sag as he realizes the truth is only going to get him in more trouble, but...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: “He” is a... (mumbling real fast) ...famoussingingprostitute... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 85.

dialogues.speaker: KACEY
dialogues.text: Toss in another twenty-five bucks and I’1l1 do her too.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (to Bruce, disgusted) My God. You really are a total waste of skin. Torn between Kacey’s demands and Kelly’s disgust, Bruce turns to Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Just... wait! Frustrated, Bruce runs back to Kacey and peels out $50.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, just take it and go! He starts back toward Kelly, then stops, lowering his voice to Kacey.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pig latin) I’1l take a raincheck on the ex- say a little ater-lay. As Kacey takes the money and leaves, Bruce runs back to Kelly as she shoves even more papers into the bin. He’s about to say something when he notices the “papers” all consist of Bruce Campbell memorabilia.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kelly, listen to me, we don’t have time to... (shocked) Hey! Those are my posters!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jeff asked me to purge his trailer. It was my pleasure. She stuffs a MINDWARP poster into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus! That’s the limited edition ”“B” style!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Plenty more where that came from. (annoyed) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 86.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you still here? Don’t you have a bad movie to make? Kelly pulls an Ash “Army Of Darkness” action figure from the bed of the pick-up and tosses it into the flames as Bruce winces.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: A couple, actually. But the truth is... I haven’t been able to stop thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh please. She shakes her head derisively as Bruce takes a step closer, just inches away from her.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I know it sounds crazy. I mean, we barely know each other. But I think... I think I’m in...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You wanna move that hand? PULL OUT and REVEAL Bruce’s hand jammed down the back of Kelly’s pants. Bruce pulls out his hand, chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Okay. So maybe it’s over between us. At least let me help you rescue Jeff. Kelly stops in the midst of jamming another poster into the flames, startled.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jeff needs to be rescued?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: He called me this morning. He’s going after the Guan-Di!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: I thought you knew! Kelly looks toward the sky, the sun close to setting.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh my God! It’1ll be dark soon. (intense) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 87.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to get the town together, now! As Kelly grabs a cell-phone from her pocket, frantically punching a number, Bruce tries to pluck the smoldering Bruce doll from the flames... INT. KELLY’S BAR - NIGHT A group of grumbling townfolk, several sporting new splints, bandages on their faces, crutches and other medical evidence of Bruce shooting spree have gathered in Kelly’s bar. A rumble of discontent magnifies into open rebellion when BRUCE appears. As if on cue, the entire mob surges forward and grabs Bruce, pinning him against the wall, punching him.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: OWWW! Wait! OWW! A boy’s life OWW hangs in UMPH the balance!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Stop it! Now! The angry ROAR subsides. The crowd, still holding Bruce, turns toward Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let him talk. Bruce stares into their faces, all seething with sheer rage, then...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Look, rural folk, I know I let you down... and I’m sorry. But the callow movie star who came into your lives yesterday is not the man standing before you today. The Townfolk release Bruce and take a step back, tentatively giving Bruce a moment to redeem himself.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s right. It took the faith of a kid like Jeff, and the decency of a good woman like Kelly to help me see the light. In the last twenty four hours, I’ve learned a little something about honor. Respect. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 88.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (he looks at Kelly) Maybe even love. This time even Kelly is touched by Bruce’s sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man’s not much if he can’t own up to his mistakes. So I’m here to apologize, but more importantly, to makes this right. (heartfelt) I’m not just asking you for a second chance. I’m begging you for one. There’s a long moment of silence. Bruce stands there a moment, then REVERSE THE ANGLE, revealing that the room is COMPLETELY EMPTY. Everyone just left, except Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You moved ‘em, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gates loom in the darkness as headlights wash across the gate. After a moment, Jeff steps from his car, grabbing a rifle and a flashlight. As he closes the car door, a breeze kicks up a flutter of leaves that wash across the old tombstones.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay. This was a bad idea. As Jeff stares at the moldering graves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocks begin to rattle, signaling the re-emergence of the demonic Guan-Di. As the rock-fall clatters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff hears the rocks moving and gets the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Scratch “maybe.” As Jeff nervously holds his position, rifle in hand, waiting for the Guan-Di to emerge...  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 89. INT. KELLY’S PICK-UP/EXT. ROAD - NIGHT Kelly hunched over the wheel, steaming mad. Bruce is sitting beside her, reeling from her verbal assault. As they tear down the road, the last vestiges of sunlight disappearing behind the trees...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Big ass movie-star. Haven’t you ever heard of a TELEPHONE?! No, YOU had to waste eight hours DRIVING all the way back.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Thought chick’s got off on the whole mano a mano thing.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Mano a moron, you mean... Bruce glances through the back cab window, looking at the Bruce Campbell memorabilia scattered in the truck bed. Posters, cardboard standees and even scripts.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Light-bulb going off, Bruce reaches through the window into the back truck bed...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Don’t mess around. My demolition supplies are back there. Bruce looks again, noticing a wooden crate that says DYNAMITE.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You keep a crate of dynamite in your truck?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You don’t? Bruce doesn’t have an answer to that. He fumbles a little more, pulling back with a handful of OLD SCRIPTS.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing with those? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 90.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Listen, sister, maybe your idea of a “plan” is to tap this Guan-Di on the shoulder and “pretty-please” him to death, but seems to me we’re gonna need more than that.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: And you think you’re can find it in one of your old scripts?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Brilliant Hollywood writers spent weeks on these stories!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Gimme a break...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Rising action, character arcs, set ups and pay offs...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I’ve seen better plots ina Bazooka Joe comic! Bruce sneers at the insult, flipping open a script. He reads a second, then...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: This could work -- where’s the closest oceanic oil drilling platform?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Ireland. Miffed, Bruce tosses that script out the window, opens another.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You got any abandoned steel mills with giant vats of molten metal? Kelly shakes her head “no.” Bruce tosses that one, tries again.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Extensive cave systems with cannibal bats underneath an active volcano? Kelly shakes her head no again. Out goes another script. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 91.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: An island full of mutated giant gorillas? No, wait, I died in that one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly suddenly veers off the main road, taking the same dirt road we saw Jeff and Clayton take earlier. As Bruce SLAMS against the side of the truck from the turn...

dialogues.speaker: UMPH
dialogues.text: (rubbing his head) Do you even know where you’re going?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jeff‘s friends were killed outside an old Chinese cemetary. I’m guessing that’s...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (cuts her off) Lady, guesswork is the last thing we need right now. She points out the window at a sign nailed to a tree. "Jeff's this way!”

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: The signs help. They careen down the dirt road, coming up on the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Kelly pull up to the old cemetary, a waft of dust rolling over them as they park next to Jeff’s car. Kelly jumps out and looks in Jeff's vehicle, scared when she realizes he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. He’s gone. (yelling) Jeff! JEFF! No answer. As Kelly gets more concerned.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Boy’s got any sense, he’s probably hightailing it back to town. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 92.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: If he had any sense, he wouldn’t have called you. (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: As Kelly continues calling, Bruce reaches into Kelly’s truck and grabs a rifle off the gun rack.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: We'd better split up. You go around to the right, I'll go... (bumps into someone)

dialogues.speaker: AHHHH
dialogues.text: Bruce YELPS as he turns around, realizing he bumped into JEFF, who was standing right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jeff! As Kelly runs toward her son, Bruce notices that Jeff's frozen in fear, his eyes wide and staring.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (eyes fixed) Hi, Bruce. With trepidation, Bruce follows Jeff's stare across the graveyard, to... THE FEARSOME GUAN-DI, looming in the shadows, sword gleaming in the moonlit darkness. As Kelly reaches Jeff, pulling him close in a hug, she also sees the demonic creature. Oh no... Rifle in hand, Bruce steps in front of Kelly and Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Stay behind me. (cocks rifle) Things heat up, Mr. Winchester’s gonna get mighty nervous. Suddenly, the stand-off is broken when another figure enters, just in front of the Guan-Di. It’s old WING, the bowling Chinese wise man!

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: Mr. Campbell. So you have returned. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 93.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: That’s right, Wing.

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: You think you can destroy Guan-Di? Destroy the protector of the dead? You’re a fool!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Pot meet kettle, pajama-man.

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: Don’t you see? The demon is under my command... exacting my revenge against those who have scorned me... he’s nothing more than an empty-headed vessel doing my bidding... The Guan-Di looks down at Wing with a cranky “huh? What’d you say?” look.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Uhh --

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Mr. Wing! He’s right behind you! Wing LAUGHS at Kelly’s concern, pulling a small packet of food from his Chinese robe.

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: I have nothing to fear from Guan- Di, for I have come with the sacred bean curd. Bruce glances toward that mottled sign at the mouth of the graveyard. PRO ECTE FO THOSE WH DIE . BEWA E HOSE WITHOUT EAN URD.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kelly, that sign! (beat) “Protected for those who died... beware those without bean curd!” Of course! Wing laughs at Bruce, Kelly and Jeff, taking an enormous bite of the (rank) bean curd.

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: (curd spilling from his mouth) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 94.

dialogues.speaker: WING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see! HA HA HA HA!! Mmmm, good! While Wing is chuckling, the Guan-Di is getting seriously pissed. He rises to his full height behind Wing, eyes blazing red with rage.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Wait a sec. Didn’t you say the Guan-Di protects the dead -- ZOOM IN on Wing, bean curd still spilling from his mouth, as he glances back and sees the Guan-Di’s demonic, angry eyes glowing over him. Bean curd still spilling from his mouth, Wing suddenly realizes he’s hosed.

dialogues.speaker: WING
dialogues.text: Good poin -- The Guan-Di suddenly LASHES OUT, his silver blade lopping off Wing’s head with one savage whack! Bean curd goes flying as the Guan-Di turns his demonic red eyes toward Bruce and Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce -- Bruce contemplates his next move, snapping his fingers as he gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Wait, wait one minute... (remembering) There was one other script... I did pass on it... more like a rewrite... actually, I saved the thing, Writer’s Guild screwed me out of my credit...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce, what is it?! Bruce suddenly raises his rifle and aims it, NOT at the Guan-Di but at the tree branches over the Guan-Di’s head.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sweet little number that goes something like this -- Bruce FIRES! The bullet hits a branch over the Guan-Di’s head and splits it off, sending it dropping straight toward the demon. The Guan-Di looks up as the branch comes down -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 95.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MISSING HIM BY INCHES and crashing into a pile of LOGS by the Guan-Di’s feet. The impact dislodges the logs and sends them rolling out of the graveyard... STRAIGHT TOWARD BRUCE, KELLY AND JEFF.

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: Kelly and Jeff bolt, but Bruce TRIPS over a fallen branch and pancakes to the ground as the Guan-Di approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kelly! Jeff! Run! As they sprint off, the Guan-Di reaches Bruce and PICKS HIM UP BY THE SCRUFF OF HIS SHIRT...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ayiyaiyaiyai... Then the Guan-Di THROWS Bruce across the graveyard. Bruce SLAMS into one of the old markers and slides to the ground, groaning. He’s struggling to pick himself up when the Guan-Di suddenly looms over him, grabbing him and HURLING BRUCE into Kelly’s pick-up. Bruce’s ass crunches in the windshield, then he rolls off and hits the dirt. As Bruce tries to get up, the Guan-Di’s shadow looms over him again.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait... can’t we talk this ouwWWW... The Guan-Di lifts Bruce to his feet so they’re looking at each other eye to eye, then the Guan-Di SLAMS his palm into Bruce’s chest. ETHEREAL FIRE explodes from the contact as Bruce’s eyes flutter, stretching into an “oriental” configuration and turning demonic red. He’s been POSSESSED by the Guan-Di!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (growling) Nhhggrrrrrr... The Guan-Di releases Bruce and he staggers back, walking jerkily, like a puppet on a string... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 96.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Am... u... let...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly and Jeff are racing through the moonlit woods, around trees and dense foliage, desperate to get away.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Hurry, Jeff, run!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: (over shoulder) But, but what about... SUDDENLY THE POSSESSED BRUCE springs up in front of them. Kelly SCREAMS as Jeff SLAMS right into him. Bruce’s hand SNAPS OUT and grab Jeff around the throat, choking him. His other hand reaches for Jeff's pocket, and the Asian amulet (which has been there since Jeff put it there, back in his trailer).

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (possessed) You... released Guan-Di... took am- u-let...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce! What are you doing? As Jeff chokes, unable to break free, Kelly tries to punch Bruce away, but he’s too strong.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For God's sakes, Bruce! Let him go! Desperate, Kelly finds a heavy branch on the ground and swings it like a BASEBALL BAT, smashing it across the back of Bruce’s head. But the limb simply disintegrates into dust as Bruce continues to choke Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (possessed) ...took... keeeeyyyy... beaaannn curd...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Oh God oh God oh God... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Desperate, getting an idea, Kelly picks up on the possessed Bruce’s last comment and BOLTS back toward the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly races to Wing’s decapitated body. Looking for something, she kneels by Wing’s corpse, prying open his dead hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly runs back into the woods. Jeff is faltering, gasping as possessed Bruce continues to choke him. Suddenly, KELLY rushes up to the demonic Bruce and STUFFS a handful of bean-curd into his mouth!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Suck on that, hell-demon! Let him go! Bean curd dribbling from his possessed lips, Bruce releases Jeff, rears back and ROARS toward the Heavens. Spitting curd into the sky. Then, spent, Bruce drops to his knees, head down, gasping. Not willing to take any chances, KELLY finds another thick branch and raises it, preparing for a killing stroke. She hesitates, just for a moment, eyes filling with unexpected tears...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... I’m sorry... As she swings, Bruce’s hand suddenly SNAPS UP and catches her wrist mid-swing. Bruce’s head is still down, so for an instant we don’t know if this is real or Memorex-Demon Bruce until... HE LOOKS UP. His eyes clear, back to normal. Slowly shaking his head “no” as he stands, savoring Kelly’s relief.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You're sorry. That bean-curd tastes like... The heroic moment is muted when Jeff, angry after being choked, KICKS BRUCE IN THE BALLS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 98.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: OOmphhhh! !

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch, you tried to kill me!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: (pained voice) No... it was the demon... the one without balls... Still in agony, Bruce shows them the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And this... is what it’s after.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Costume jewelry?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Not quite. (glaring at Jeff) Genius here took it when he unleashed Hari-Kari-Larry. It’s a sacred amulet, the one that brings peace to the Guan-Di and the souls of the dead. You know. Just THE

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Easy. We can play the blame game later. Question is, what do we do now? Bruce pulls himself together. Looks into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: What else you got in that truck of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN TIGHT on a smiling, heroic Bruce Campbell face. Slowly PULL BACK to reveal it’s actually a CARDBOARD STANDEE from the CAVEALIEN movie, featuring Bruce in his uniform. The box of DYNAMITE right behind it. The Standee is perched between some fallen rocks in the mouth of the cave. CONTINUE PULLING BACK to reveal Bruce and Kelly rolling demolition wire out away from the standee, toward a  Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce and Kelly bring the wire back to Jeff, waiting with the dynamite plunger.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Way I figure it, this demon has a serious hard-on for yours truly. When he spots my puss on his doorstep he’s gonna go Pearl Harbor, and that’s when we drop the mountain on his Jackie-Chan ass.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Sounds risky.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s our only standee. But right now it’s our only... In the distance, they HEAR the demonic YOWL of the Guan- Di. Jeff, hooking up the wires to an old-fashioned “shove the handle down” detonator box, shivers.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Jesus. He’s coming back. As they finish their preparations, Bruce looks Kelly and Jeff in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Look, however this turns out, I just want you both to know... Kelly and Jeff both take a breath, like they know the sentiment that Bruce is going for...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-that I’1l never forgive you for dragging me out here. In the distance, the Guan-Di moves out of the woods into the moonlight. His gleaming sword WET with blood. As he nears the cave entrance...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold... hold it... wait until he’s inside the cave... The Guan-Di sees the smiling Bruce standee in the cave entrance and REARS BACK, GROWLING. With a samurai change, it runs at the standee, blade high. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 100.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s seen it! Easy... easy... But just as it seems it’s going to take the bait and go into the cave entrance, the Guan-Di STOPS. Like it senses something’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: He’s not buying it! Shit! That’s a great likeness, too.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? Bruce collects himself, shaking his head. Can’t believe he’s about to do this...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Wait here. I’m going in.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce, wait! That’s suicide!

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: You're right. Bruce shoves his rifle into Kelly’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'd better do it.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Bruce, the Guan-Di’s going to be looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Kay-rist.... (takes gun back) All right. I'11 try to lure him into the cave. The second he does inside, you drop that plunger. Got me? Bruce is about to take off when...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Bruce! Wait. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 101.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She suddenly, impulsively pulls Bruce into a tight embrace. They look into each other’s eyes, then, just as they’re about to kiss...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanna move that hand? Bruce looks down, surprised. PULL BACK to reveal that for once, he’s NOT groping her.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: But I... Kelly smiles, takes his hands and pulls them around her in a passionate embrace. Then they kiss, passionate, the kind of kiss a girl gives a guy right before he heads off to war. As they finally break...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: For luck.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Another kiss like that, I could win the lottery. Bruce nods back to Jeff, poised over the plunger, then BOLTS FOR THE CAVE ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guan-Di turns as it hears Bruce running toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: All right, Top Ramen, let’s do this! The Guan-Di raises his sword, the steel glinting in the moonlight, as Bruce runs at him and TACKLES HIM STRAIGHT BACK INTO THE CAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff realizes it’s time to do the deed, but he’s frozen over the plunger.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Jeff!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Mom, I... I can’t! (anguished) It... it’s Bruce Campbell! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 102.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I know how much he means to you... how much he means to audiences the world over... but right now, you've got to ask yourself one question. (beat) What would Bruce Campbell do? Jeff thinks a moment, then shrugs and SLAMS DOWN the plunger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave entrance EXPLODES in a plume of fire and rock. As the explosion settles, dust and smoke billowing, an eerie quiet falls across the scene. KELLY and JEFF slowly move toward the cave entrance. It’s completely sealed by fallen rock. Horrified by what they’ve done, Jeff and Kelly drop to their knees outside the blast area. BRUCE'S SMILING FACE, torn from the shattered standee, grins at them from the dusty boulders.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I... I can’t believe he’s gone. Suddenly there’s a RATTLE of rock by the cave entrance. Kelly and Jeff turn, fearing the worst, stunned to see BRUCE’S BLOODIED HAND clawing out of the rubble.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: They rush over and throw away some of the rocks, pulling Bruce free. He’s battered and bloodied, but alive.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Somebody get the license number of that truck? As they pull Bruce out, he makes a point of taking the stolen amulet from his pocket and JAMMING it into the rocks.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And STAY there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 103.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wobbly, Bruce takes Kelly’s hand, and with Jeff beside them, they begin to limp away from the cave. It’s a quiet moment, the horror finally winding down.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just got one request, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Anything, Bruce.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Next time you release an ancient Chinese demon, call that Buffy chick, will ya? As they all share a movie-ending laugh... THE GUAN-DI BURSTS OUT OF THE ROCKS behind them. In SLOW MOTION, Bruce, Kelly and Jeff turn in horror as the monster ROARS toward them, sword high, about to kill them...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: cut! (regular motion) Cut cut cut cut CUT! All action stops. The Guan-Di pulls up short, puzzled. Kelly and Jeff take a step back, watching as Bruce goes out of character.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t working. (re: Kelly) First of all, could props swing a little mouthie-washie for Ms. Romania 1992? Kissing this broad’s like licking a cat’s ass.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (Romanian accent) Up yours. PULL BACK to reveal we’re on an EXTERIOR MOVIE SET. A gaffer’s truck nearby reads ROMANIAN LIGHTING SERVICES. As the crew chatter in ROMANIAN, the DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY (the same guy we saw shooting CAVEALIEN) steps into frame.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
dialogues.text: What’s the problem, B.C.? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 104.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: A blind man could see it! The audience is going to be totally invested in my character by this point. We pull the ol’ “surprise, they all die” ending, we’re gonna lose ‘em. (slaps Fred on the back) People love me, Fred. They want me to win.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Don’t argue with the muse. Bruce paces a moment, snapping his fingers, the picture of “the creative process.” Finally, triumphant, like he’s hit on the solution...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pack up these potato eaters. We’re moving on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lovely little country home on a bright sunny day. After a moment, KELLY, wearing a pretty summer dress, steps out, smiling broadly as BRUCE comes down the walk, jaunty and heroic.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Sore eyes, meet sight-for. I could use some serious feel-good about now.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Step right up, movie-star. As they sweep back in a romantic kiss, Jeff, now dressed like a college preppy, walks out on the porch, smiling at all the love on display. As Bruce and Kelly break off their kiss, Jeff unfolds an official looking letter.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Guys, guess what! I was just accepted to Yale! Bruce and Kelly both rush to Jeff, pulling him close. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 105.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Told you that C average wouldn’t matter! (pulls them together) Come on. Group hug! As they hold one another, savoring their new, perfect lives, suddenly a shadow washes over them. As they turn, eyes going wide in horror, reveal THE GUAN-DI standing over them, raising his sword and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Guan-Di image frozen on a small screen, Bruce leans back from a flatbed, enraptured with the conclusion of his latest masterpiece. He gives his weary editor a nudge.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Perfecto. Fanboy’s will be creaming their jeans over the false ending. (cocky, to editor) Take three more seconds off Kelly’s close-up... no, make it five... and hold on me. Then give me a fade and a dissolve... pre- lap that dialogue... show me some magic, baby! Suddenly there’s another demonic RUMBLE. The editing room SHAKES. Cocky Bruce suddenly looks nervous... what the hell is going on? Suddenly the fierce Guan-Di demon

dialogues.speaker: BURSTS INTO THE EDITING ROOM
dialogues.text: and careens toward a SCREAMING BRUCE (just like the ending of the first EVIL DEAD). CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN, the violent editing room scene fades to black. Bruce leans back in a comfy chair in the plush screening room, puffing a stogie, savoring the completion of his latest epic. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verheiden "My Name Is Bruce" 4/2/06 106.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE
dialogues.text: Two trick endings! Get my publicist on the phone and tell her to book my tickets to the Saturn Awards. ‘cause we’ve got a winner! (hits intercom) Okay, Morrie, roll it again! Bruce leans back, savoring his smoke, when suddenly we hear another RUMBLE... and Guan-Di suddenly LEAPS ACROSS THE SCREENING ROOM and lunges at Bruce as he stands and SCREAMS, mimicking (again) the end of EVIL DEAD... FADE OUT.
